favourite.article: Blessed to discover this site divinely led by God stay blessed!
The Lord brought the song to my mind during warfare.
I had this song in my head and had to find out tune. Such a lovely song I haven't sung in years.

I have written a couple of other verses to go with the original. Happy singing:
I’ve been crucified with Christ, Been crucified with Him. I’ve been crucified with Christ, Been crucified with Him. He died, He died, Jesus died for you and me. I’ve been crucified with Christ, Been crucified with Him.
I been raised to life in Christ, Been raised to life in Him. I been raised to life in Christ, Been raised to life in Him. He rose, He rose, Jesus rose in victory. I been raised to life in Christ, Been raised to life in Him.
It’s no longer I that liveth, But Christ that liveth in me. It’s no longer I that liveth, But Christ that liveth in me. He lives, He lives, Jesus is alive in me! It’s no longer I that liveth, But Christ that liveth in me.
Without Christ who lives in me and I who live in Him we are nothing.
Hallelujah! Christ lives in us! How boldly we can declare that it's no longer we that live!
We sing this song every service at our church. Have been singing it all morning. Love it.
Thanks for uploading this to Youtube. I could use it for my cell group worship time.

In the Salvation Army our words for this chorus are slightly different.
"It's no longer I that liveth, But Christ that liveth in me. It's no longer I that liveth, But Christ that liveth in me. In me! In me! Jesus Christ's alive in me! It's no longer I that liveth, But Christ that liveth in me."
Oh Lord, thank You that You are living in me.

I haven't heard this song or even recalled in about 20 odd years...until this morning. I woke up from sleep with it ring in my heart. I had to look for the exact words on the internet. I have since been hoping about and singing it all day. Praise God!
I love this song, not only because it says the truth but also because sally ellis who wrote it, is my grandma's sister :)

What a relief! It's no longer I that liveth! Galatians 2:20 - By singing this hymn, I am brought to a level above any situation that I may be going through. It's a way to experience an organic salvation...salvation from ourselves!

It is Christ Jesus that is living in me!! Oh how marvelous He is! I only want Him to live!! It's no longer I who lives! I really appreciate this song because it reminds me that He desires to live in me. 'No longer I! 'Christ in me I'll testify! Oh Lord, live through and through in me!!!
